column1: full and swinging away a touch from around off stump, Masood jams his bat down on it
length outside off, nice shape away again, Masood watches it closely through to the keeper
length outside off again, not as much shape away this time, just went straight on, left alone again
length and angled in from a little wide on the crease, Masood watches it under his eyes and defends, somewhat tentatively
nearly squares him up, it was angled in from wide on the crease again, he was shaping to clip it to the on side but decided against it as the ball held in the surface a little and straightened
overpitched around off, driven crisply into the covers but straight to the fielder
length around middle, jags back in sharply but slides down the leg side, well collected by the keeper diving to his left
another one starts too straight, middle and leg and on a length and slides down the leg side, the keeper collects this quite low
full outside off, lovely stride into the ball from Abid who is coming off his maiden hundred, driven straight to mid-off
shortens his length and starts closer to off, bit of extra bounce as Abid is beaten by pace and struck on the thigh pad
full and swinging in a touch, not as quick as the last one, Abid tries to turn it around through square leg but misses, gets a leg bye in that general direction, as the ball trickles away off the pad
beaten! Length around off and shaping away, a laden footed Masood goes feeling for it with his hands as it misses his outside edge by a whisker
really full with a hint of swing back in, almost a yorker, digs it out
full again but angled across this time, Abid watches it through to the keeper
length and angled across, Abid shoulders arms again
length starting a lot straighter and shaping back in, slides down the leg side
full around off, great length and testing line, Abid comes forward and watches it into the keeper's gloves
great length again, drawing him forward, straighter this time, Abid defends confidently back to the bowler
length around middle, jags back in and strikes him near the thigh as he misses the clip beaten by both pace and bounce, the appeal is immediately turned down, would have gone over
edged and that's the first boundary of the morning! Length and angled across this time, Masood goes fishing but luckily squirts it away through the cordon
short one, angled across, sways out of its way
back of a length around middle and off, shaping away a touch, Masood is tentative on the defence again, guides it to backward point
length and angled across, too wide to lure him into having a poke this time
full around middle and off, Masood comes forward nicely into the ball this time and drives crisply to mid-on
length and angled across, left alone safely
length again, angled across but closer to off than the last one, shoulders arms again
full and angled across, opens the face and defends to gully
pulls his length back, goes straighter and this one jags back in sharply, Abid brings his bat down in time to keep it out

short and wide outside off and he pounces on it! He feasted on these last match and seems to be carrying on, don't bowl there to anyone, but particularly not Abid, rocks back and cuts it hard over point
length and angled across, left alone
length, angling across, defended into the off side with soft hands and they come through for a quick single
back of a length, angling in, Abid stands tall and defends off the backfoot
another one back of a length, gun-barrel straight, stands tall and defends back to the bowler
compensates and goes full and straight, defended again
back to back of a length, around off stump, Abid transfers his weight back nicely and defends
better ball, fuller around off, held in the pitch ever so slightly, defended to point with an open face

absolute ripper cleans him up! A near perfect delivery, particularly to someone reluctant to come forward and cover the line completely, nice and full around off, threatening to keep coming in with the angle, straightens audaciously late and whizzes past the tentative prod to take out the off stump. Out comes an under pressure Azhar Ali
length and nice and tight around off stump, Azhar watches it through to the keeper

knocks out the captain with a cracker now! The length was the key again, it was full and shaping back in, Azhar Ali was rooted to the crease and played outside the line, in a manner you'd expect someone who hasn't made a fifty in over 12 innings, make it 13 now, as Azhar falls for a two-ball duck.
length this time, but too straight and slides down the leg side
overcompensates and goes across, too wide to tempt Babar
fuller and angled across again, left alone again. Fernando has breathed life into an otherwise sedate morning
full around off, draws him forward, great length, Abid does well with his confident stride into the ball, defends it back
short one angled in at the body, ducks under it and it dies on the way to the keeper

back of a length around off, he rocks back on to the backfoot using the depth of the crease expertly, gets right on top of the bounce and punches it through the covers for A cracking boundary. Shot of the morning
little fuller and straighter around middle and off, defended solidly again
full around off, comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler, who hurls it back as Abid rushes out of the way to avoid the throw
full and quick around off, opens the face and defends towards gully
full and swinging back in, there's some excitement among the fielders as Babar nearly falls over, takes a bit of the pad through to the keeper
Similar delivery, starts around middle and leg and slides down with the movement, Babar was shuffling again, but gets some bat on it and glances it fine for four
full around off, comes forward and defends

really full and that beautiful swing back in again, starts a bit to straight again though, Babar shuffles a little again as the ball seems to kiss his pad on the way to the keeper, there's a stifled appeal but no genuine interest
length around off, defended, he's comfortable there

seems to be a concerted effort to go really straight at Babar, are they trying to knock his leg stump out? He continues to shuffle a fair bit, misses the leg glance this time as the full one slides down the leg side
length around off, hint of nibble, defended
length around off, defended again
width and pounces on it! It was a similar length but allowed him to free his arms, punches it through the covers in what fast becoming his trademark stroke
full around off, better ball, defended

short and angled in and he hammers a pull behind square this time! They are checking if it's a four or a six, looks like it's gone all the way, and that's really what that ball deserved. Dimuth started well but is soon discovering the tiny margin for error he has at his pace
length and angled in, tucked away through square leg for one
length around off, Abid rocks right back and tries to force it through the off side, cramped for a bit room, can't get it away
too much width this time and Sri Lanka are not learning that he feasts on anything in this area, uses the depth of the crease and punches it powerfully through extra cover for four
fuller and closer to off, left alone
tight leave but a good one in the end, it was length around off and straightening ever so slightly, the bowler had his hands on his head as Abid let it through. Pretty close but safe
length and too straight, tucked away towards midwicket for one

misses a full toss and given! It was really full and swinging back in, Babar was probably surprised by how full it was, no other explanation for why he missed that, but he also reviews straight away, which probably means he didn't miss it completely, after all. And yes, replays confirm an inside edge, Babar survives, Pakistan breathe
drops this massively short, and turns away. Abid goes back and cuts this away towards deep point
short again, and given the treatment again! Rocks back and that gives him time and space to place it where he wants. Goes a bit forward of square on the off-side this time
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
slower, turns across him, and beats the outside edge! This will encourage the spinners on both sides
floated around off, and he drives towards cover
tossed up, and he stretches forward to defend
fuller, a bit wider, and he drives this towards mid-off
length, jags back a touch at him, and he defends this towards the man at short leg
full, and he runs this towards wide third man. Just jams his bat down and opens the face of the bat to run it to the left of gully. Smart shot
length, down the leg side and he looks to flick, but fails to make contact
full, angles across him, and he lets this go through to the keeper
full, wide and he is lulled into a drive. Misses out on contact. No feet movement, and that's why he was playing well away from his body. Good bowling again from Vishwa!
short, and he goes back to punch this, but cannot beat point
length, moves sharply across him, and he keeps his bat close to body to see this through
length, presses forward to smother this around off
fuller, straighter, and he drives this towards mid-on
tossed up around off, and given some extra revs. Spins viciously past his outside edge! Some good bounce too. Abid is beaten, and then does some gardening
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
length, angles across him from leg to off, and he defends solidly from the crease
length, outside off, and swings wildly away after crossing Babar, who leaves
length, slants across him and hits the bat hard as Babar stretches forward to defend. Takes his bottom hand off as he drops it dead near his feet
fuller, a touch wider, looking to tease Babar into an indiscreet drive, but he leaves this after watching it through
full, driven wide of mid-off. Beats a diving cover, and gives them ample time to tick the strike over
length, nips away after pitching around off, and he leaves
length, and he presses forward to defend
skips forward to a length ball, and Embuldeniya drops it a touch shorter. Forced to stretch to block the ball
flighted around off, and he drives this square towards deep cover
length, and he goes back to defend one turning across him
fuller, but down the leg side, and he sweeps this away. Not a lot of grace in that shot, but effective, and smart. A little roll of the wrists takes the ball fine enough
length, and he presses forward to defend a ball around off
length, just outside off, and he leaves. A bit of seam movement away
length, nips back in, and he defends from the crease, with a little hop to ride the bounce
length, a bit of movement back in from outside off, and Babar leaves
a bit shorter, angles in, and he drops it towards point with soft hands. They set off for a single, and make it comfortably
shorter, but he has ample time to hop and ride the bounce. Punches it back towards mid-off
full, and he looks to drive. Off the inner part of the blade towards square leg. Abid admonishes himself for not getting to the pitch of that ball
short, and he goes back and punches this beautifully through cover. Hit hard and well, and beats the man posted at deep point too
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
presses forward, and a length ball turns and goes off the outer edge. Trickles away towards point and they pick up the single on offer
turn from a length, but he presses forward to defend
ball! A touch quicker, and fizzes past his outside edge as he shapes to get behind the line. Turn and bounce
length, straightens in from around leg and middle. Defended with a short forward press
full, and he presses forward to drive this between cover and mid-off. Terrific shot, and brings up the fifty of this partnership
full, straighter, and he drives this towards mid-wicket. Crisp timing, but no reward for the shot
length, wider, and he stretches forward to drive this along the ground towards point
length, a bit of inward movement, and he stretches forward to defend this
full, angles in, and he looks to drive straight. Off the inner part of the blade, and skews away towards mid-wicket
length, outside off, and he stretches forward to defend. Off the edge, but along the ground towards point, this was bowled at 139.4kph
length, around off, and he presses forward to defend. Bowled at 80.6kph
fuller, and he sweeps this from middle stump down towards fine leg
short, and he goes back to drive this. Cannot beat cover, diving away to his left, but also gets a single for his troubles
tossed up, and he stretches forward to defend. Off the inner edge, but runs away towards square leg
short, turns across him, and he goes back and tucks this away to the right of short mid-wicket
skips down the wicket, and ends up yorking himself. Tries to drive it past mid-on, but that was fired in towards his leg. No room to get it past the fielder
length, nips back from outside off, as he stretches forward to defend. Loud appeal for leg-before, but a healthy inside edge on that
fuller, straighter, and he drives this hard. Fielded by mid-on, diving away to his left

this is good. It has nipped back in from outside off and pegged him on the pads. Given out, and Abid refers this! Beaten for pace as he played from the crease. The inward movement started from just outside off. No inside edge on this, all down to tracking now! It's three reds, and Abid falls to Lahiru Kumara
full, and he drives this to mid-on
short, just outside off, nipping back in, and he defends from the crease
full, angles in, and he drives this hard towards mid-wicket
length, around middle, and he stretches forward to defend
skips forward and takes a length ball on the full. Around middle, and so he can whip this away towards mid-wicket. Easy single
oh, is this a drop? Full, and he drives it back, and it has landed just short of Embuldeniya as Shafiq drives it back
length, and he stretches forward to defend
length, straightens from leg, and he stretches forward to defend
length, around leg, and he defends towards short mid-wicket

short ball, angles into him, and he is in an awkward position as he looks to play a pull and then seems to want to pull out! Aimed at his left armpit, and he can only get it in the air, but towards the vacant square leg region
full, but wide enough to allow Shafiq to let this pass without incident
length, and he presses forward to defend
short, angles in, and he plays it well. Rides the bounce, takes the bottom hand off, and plays this to the right of short mid-wicket. Single on offer, and taken
length, and he punches this wide of cover. The fieldsman chases it down and prevents the boundary, but there's a misfield to start off, and that allows them to take three
banged in a touch short, just outside off, and he rides the bounce to defend towards point
tossed up, and he stretches forward to defend this, pitching around leg and middle
short, and he goes back and plays a handsome bunch towards extra cover. A fielder in the deep for that shot now
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
length, and he hangs back to defend a ball pitching around off
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
stretches forward and defends a length ball around leg and middle
sticks to the length that worked for him against Abid, just outside off, left alone by Babar
nice and full outside off again, perfect length, great line, any deviation from there will trouble the batsman, particularly his stock ball that nips back in
full around off, nice stride forward and crunched to mid-off
full again, closer to off, Babar drives to the left of mid-off but can't beat the man
pulls his length back ever so slightly, still around off, Babar defends solidly to the off side
full around off, Babar throws his hands at it but can't time it
nice loop, brings him forward, defended
shorter this time, he picks the length early, rocks back and punches it through extra cover, mid-off chases after and keeps it in play
tossed up around middle and leg, defended
a little quicker and full around off, defended
comes down and nearly makes into a yorker, squeezes it out to midwicket
beautiful bowling, it's like he's got it by a thread, lovely loop, drew him forward but wasn't quite there, defended close to silly point, but safely enough
cut him in half! Perfect length, just outside off, nips back in sharply with Shafiq stuck in the crease, left a yawning gap, the keeper dives to his left and to collect it
fuller around off this time, better stride forward and defends

only half forward again to one that's full and nips back in off the seam from outside off, there's that gap  between  bat and pad that the ball threatens to burst through, saved by the second line of defence after an inside edge
full and around off, comes forward and defends with bat and pad closer
full around off, he's getting it to nip back in every now and then, defended towards cover this time
full around off, Shafiq was falling over as he drove to mid-on, timed it alright but the fielder does well diving to his left
tossed up and angled in, Babar skips down the wicket, converts it into a full toss and pushes it wide of mid-on where Mathews does excellently with a dive to his right
tossed up on middle, defended
full and angled in, nudged towards square leg
full around off, opens up and drives to the sweeper on the off side
slows it up, shortens the length a little, defended
full around off, Shafiq stretches forward and pushes it into the off side
nice change up in length, first short one since the break, left alone
the drive that's becoming the pride of Pakistan and the envy of oppositions, too full, he leans into it with a bent knee, opens the face to find the gap and go square and crunches a boundary

snorter and Babar's lucky to survive! Another short one, this one kept following him, Babar, who was keen to come forward had no answers as he fended in hope, and luckily for him the ball, even though it had plenty of hang time fell right in no man's land.
full around off, comes forward and drives to mid-off
short one again, putting him through the test here, ducks under this time
another short one, outside off, Babar lets it through
a little short, Shafiq cuts without really timing it but with the fielder at cover-point napping, they come through for one
length around middle, opens up to go through the on side but the hint of turn prevents him as he checks his shot
no question of checking his shot there, skips down the track and launches the tossed up delivery down the ground for the second six of the innings
quicker, shorter and flatter, defended
pushed through again, full around off, Babar defends with bat and pad close, resulting in a massive appeal from behind the stumps but only bat there
goes full and angles it in seeing Babar skip down, he is slightly off balance as he clips it through the leg side, but gets two towards deep square leg

the short one is causing Pakistan problems, this one directed at chest height and at the body, Shafiq's caught in an awkward tangle as he tries to turn it around, but gets a top edge back on to his body
full around off, he is reluctant to come fully forward, the ball straightens off the seam and takes the outside edge but squirted through gully for three
full around off and middle this time, nicely driven to mid-on's left but he moves quickly to keep him on strike
width and all he has to do is give direction with the pace, very deliberate, guides it through gully for four
attempted yorker, anging in, clipped away nicely off the pads, towards deep square leg for two
length outside off, nips back in a little but safe enough to be left alone
full toss around off, bit of drift away and he nearly chips it back to the bowler
length around middle and leg, goes back and defends
nice drift again as Shafiq stretches forward and opens the face to drive, squirts it away towards point
full on middle, pushed to long-on
quicker and full on middle, pushed back to the bowler
short and bit of width, and that's a gift with Babar on 47, he moves on to 51 with a cracking backfoot punch through cover-point
freebie from Fernando, who seems to have forgotten that Pakistan have had their lunch, it's a half tracker on middle, and pulled imperiously in front of square
length, angling across, defended
he's getting fuller and closer to off, left alone again
slightly shorter again, angled across left alone
repeat of the last ball, angled across on a length, left alone
fuller and closer to off, defended to the off side
length on middle, defended
full with a hint of drift, pushed back to the bowler
full around middle, comes forward and defends
flatter and pushed through around off, comes forward and defends
full and angled in, skips down the track and pushes it to mid-on who is quite deep, quite inexplicably
full and angled way across Shafiq from wide on the crease, left alone
length this time, angled across again, closer to off but still a bit too wide to interest Shafiq into playing
this is short and wide, Shafiq cuts hard but there's a deep point, strange field setting, but useful if you're bowling like that
full on middle, Babar drives crisply to mid-on, his balance a lot better now than when the ball was swinging back in from Fernando
overpitched and angled across, Babar leans into the cover drive but can't beat the man diving to his left
pulls his length back and goes across again, left alone without any drama
full on middle, pushed to mid-on who continues to be too deep
tossed up on off, hint of drift, comes forward and defends
full around middle, defended again
quicker and flatter, stands tall and pushes it back
slower and full around off, pushed to the deep mid-on for one

full on middle, pushed to midwicket for one to bring up the fifty stand. The duo have had some luck, particularly against Kumara early in the second session but they've fought their way through and have Sri Lanka a little bit on the defensive suddenly
length around off, defended into the off side, they consider a quick one but decide against it
full and angled across, left alone. Fernando appears considerably less threatening this spell with the ball just going across the batsmen
length around middle and off, pushed to mid-on's left for one
length outside off, but of width, Babar stands tall and punched it behind point, but there's protection on the fence
change of angle, comes around the wicket, gun barrel straight now from Fernando, no movement, Shafiq defends back
rally full around off, almost floated up, hint of swerve in the air on that occasion, the idea is to make the batsman close the face early, defended with a straight bat, however
close call, length around middle, bit of extra bounce as he tries to nudge it to the leg side, just eludes short leg for one
tossed up around middle, defended
full on middle, pushed to the deep mid-on
full on middle, this isn't the best line either, too defensive, defended again
tossed up around middle and off, skips down and pushes it to midwicket
short and wide to end the over and Babar accepts it gleefully, rocks back and wait for it to cut it fine, behind square for four
back over the wicket, full and angled across, pushed into the off side, and with the Sri Lankan fielders hanging on their heels, they come through for a quick one
full on middle, driven sweetly back at the bowler, who gets hand on it in his follow through and mid-on mops up
short one, good one over the right shoulder, Babar goes for the pull but is unable to drag it across as the edge of his bat
length and angled across, pushed into the gully region and they come through for a quick single
around the wicket but starts to straight, Shafiq uses the angle to whip it through midwicket for a couple
length outside off, watches it into the keeper's gloves
length, and he stretches forward to defend
defends a length ball by pressing forward to smother it
tossed up, around off and middle, and he comes forward to defend with a dead bat
flighted, around middle, and he comes forward to defend. At 84.8kph, slightly quicker than what he bowled in the morning

ooh, this is classy, and Babar is gone! Tosses this up a bit, and shortens the length a touch. Babar skips down the wicket, but is beaten by the turn across the face of the bat. He's stranded a long way down the pitch, and Dickwella does the rest. Classy bit of bowling to get rid of the dangerous in-form batsman. Sri Lanka will fancy their chances now of restricting Pakistan to an amenable total
length, and he defends from the crease
length, dropped towards cover. There's a shy at the stumps at the striker's end, and there's no backup. They will come back for a second, as the man from square leg has to come a long way in
full, down the leg side, and a good take by Dickwella after Shafiq misses out on a flick
length, zips back in from around the wicket, and Shafiq defends with bat very close to body
length, just on that off-stump line, and he defends with a little forward press
short, down the leg side, and he leaves. Intended to aim this closer to Shafiq's body, but failed in that endeavour

fuller length, down the leg side. He looks to flick, and it goes down the leg side and Dickwella collects. Not given caught-behind, and Sri Lanka don't review either. Off the thigh-pad, indicates umpire Oxenford
length, around the wicket to Sohail, who hangs back and looks to play this off his hips toward square leg. Off the thigh pad and goes to short fine-leg
length, comes on with the arm, and Shafiq goes back to defend this
tossed up around off, and he stretches and gets it past cover-point for a single
tossed up around middle, and he defends from the crease
tossed up around middle and off, and he drives with the turn towards mid-on

that's the one he's looking for! Goes on with the arm, and goes just past the outside edge as Sohail plays from the crease. Collected by Dickwella, who then lets out a loud appeal. Not given, and Sri Lanka seem content with that decision
strays down the pads, and he defends this along the ground to short leg
length, and he presses forward to defend one coming into him from middle
fuller, and he can drive this with the turn towards long-on
length, and he goes back and defends as it straightens after pitching around off
fuller, and he drives this back towards Perera
length, and he presses forward to defend
length, just around off, and he steps forward to drive this hard. Goes to cover
length, and he presses forward to defend. Off the inner part of the bat and drops towards short mid-wicket
tossed up around middle, and he plays a flat sweep through mid-wicket. Hit hard, and placed well
tossed up around middle. and he places this past cover towards the sweeper on the deep cover fence

uses his feet and smacks this down the long-on fence! This is the Haris Sohail we see often in white-ball cricket. Using his feet to spinners, and then going through with the shot. Easy swing of the arms, and comfortably clears the fence
fuller ball, whipped away towards deep mid-wicket
length, and he plays from the crease with a dead bat to defend one coming into him with the angle
leaves one angling straight with the arm, from outside off
tossed up, and he drives this past short cover towards the man in the deep
fetches this from outside off, and gets this down to the fine leg fence. Terrific bit of placement. Dinks it down after moving across the width of the stumps
length, turns into him, and he drives this back towards the bowler
fuller, outside off, and he drives this back down the pitch. Perera fields, diving away to his right
tossed up around off, and he stretches forward to defend
length, angles across him, and he defends from the crease
down the leg side, and he leaves
length, down the leg side, and Dickwella fails to pick this up. Sohail was shouldering arms anyway, but those are free runs for Pakistan
tossed up around off, and he flicks towards mid-on
tossed up, and he drives back to the left of the bowler
tossed up around middle, and he defends towards short mid-wicket
stretches forward to a length ball and drives this hard to mid-off
full, outside off, and he drives this towards mid-on
short of a length, turns in from outside off, and he defends from the crease
length, towards leg, and he plays this with the turn towards mid-wicket
fuller, straighter, and he drives this back towards the bowler
tossed up around off, and he goes back and cuts this hard. Cannot beat point
presses forward to defend a length ball around off and middle

length, and he goes back after feigning to come forward. Cuts this away late, and places it to the left of point. Terrific timing, as he uses the pace of the ball to give it direction. All the way through to the fence, between deep point and third man!
presses forward to smother a length ball around off and middle
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
dug in short, down the leg side, and Sohail ducks under this. Collected by the keeper skipping away to his right
length, around leg stump, and he plays this away towards deep backward square leg
length, angles in from outside off, and he defends from the crease
length, and he presses forward to meet it with a dead bat

fuller, and he plays a picture-perfect on-drive. Game chase from the man at mid-off, and he gets some support from mid-off. Relays it back to the other fielder, and they are able to prevent the boundary. Smart shot!

edged, but short of second slip! Sharp off-cutter that starts from off stump, and forces Sohail to have a poke at it. Off the edge and well short of second slip. Actually, well played by Sohail, who didn't push at it too hard.
length, and he comes forward to defend this
length, and defends this with a forward press
defends, stretching forward
stretches to drive a length ball around off, and it is half-stopped by the bowler, with cover and mid-off backing up
tossed up around off, and he drives this back towards the bowler

length, but width on offer. Another fabulous late cut! This is less of the conventional 'late cut', and more of a cut left late to play. Generates pace by using that of the ball, and slices it away towards the point fence. Two short of fifty now
short, just outside off, and he drops his wrists to evade the ball
length, around off, and he defends from the crease
ooh, very good ball! Starts coming in with the angle, forcing Sohail to have a jab at it. Moves away slightly after pitching, at good pace, and goes through to Dickwella
fast, full, around off stump, and he defends towards short cover
short, well-directed, as it comes back in from outside off. Sohail weaves away to his right and lets this go through, making sure he keeps his bat as low as possible
sharp ball, comes back into him. Takes the inside edge and hits him on the inside of the thigh. Drops right by the batsman
flighted, around leg, and he presses forward to defend
flighted, and he looks to defend with a press forward. Takes the outer part of the bat, but pops up on the unprotected off side
presses forward and defends towards short leg, instead
presses forward and drives this towards mid-on. Vishwa Fernando is a bit deep, and that allows the single, even though it was to his natural throwing arm

ooh, this looks good. And it's given leg before! The batsmen consult, and Sohail decides to review. This looks a good decision at first glance. Length ball from around the wicket, that was tossed up around off, and turned back in, and struck him quite low. Sohail simply played down the wrong line, and that's the subtle variations that the left-armer has got in his armoury. Unless he's got an inside edge, he should be gone. It misses the bat, on replays! Three reds, and another wicket for Embuldeniya. Review lost by Pakistan too!
he goes down the leg side, and he sweeps this towards fine leg. Gets good bat on it
rising delivery at the body, well handled by Shafiq, who nudges it towards deep square leg to bring up a hard fought fifty

knocks him over! Perfect delivery for a bowler who tends to bring it back in to the right hander. Pitched just outside off, ideal length to hit top of off and that's exactly what it does as it bursts through the yawning gap between Rizwan's bat and pad

full, fast and straight and Kumara is hastening the end here! Yasir was caught slightly off balance as that fast inducker struck him on the base of the front pad, dead in front of the stumps. Kumara on a hat-trick
ohhh, another full and fast one, just outside off maybe, Abbas jams his bat down and keeps it out

that's nasty! Banged it in, followed Abbas who wanted to get out of the way but was beaten by pace. It did not rise as much as he expected and struck him on the front thigh. Sri Lanka take the review, and lose it as the replays show the ball would have missed the stumps
another fast, short one, following Abbas all the way, but he manages to duck out of its way this time
full around off, pushed to long-off, he refuses the single
tossed up on around off, comes forward and defends
a little short, didn't get on top of the bounce as he attempted the cut but the point is deep and this time they take the one. The field comes in
quicker and angled in, presumably going for the front pad, comes forward and defends
tossed up on middle, Abbas defends tentatively causing excitement around the bat
big appeal but would have gone down. It was the arm ball, Abbas missed it and was struck on the pad but the line was a little too leg side
full outside off, he leans into it and caresses it through the off side, beats the diving long-off to his left and earns four much needed runs
short around off, Shafiq ducks under it safely
full around off, nips back in, Shafiq nudges it to the leg side but refuses the run, not keen to expose Abbas to the pace of Kumara
length around off, pushes it into the vast vacant space on the off side, and this time they take the single
he goes length around off, the perfect top of the off length, Abbas stands tall and defends safe to the off side
this one's a similar length but jags back sharply off the seam from around off and would have gone over as Abbas is struck high on the thigh
draws him forward, he obliges and defends
full on middle, defended
angled in and full, defended
full toss on off, swatted away to long-off for one

cracking delivery, the perfect foil for Kumara's pace! Lovely loop, hangs forever in the air as Abbas pushes forward and isn't quite there to the pitch, there's a bit of turn that takes the outside edge and the easiest catch to slip
that lovely loop again, draws him forward and isn't quite there, Shaheen manages to defend it safely away from silly point though
full on the pads, he likes it there, clips it nicely in front of square for a couple
length outside off, gets on his toes, on top of the bounce and punches it through point for a couple
full around off, comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler
pulls his length back a little, Shafiq defends to the off side
length around off, defended solidly again
short ball, he swivels and helps it along to fine leg for one, strange that the field didn't come up but maybe they'll try and keep him at the spinner's end and attack Shaheen with Kumara's pace
tossed up around off, defended
tossed up on middle, defended
full around off, reaches out and defends
pulls his length back and angles it in, defended
full and angled in and he managed to find the gap at square leg for one
tossed up around middle and off, Shaheen lunges forward and defends back to the bowler

four for Lahiru and Shafiq falls to a soft dismissal! It was really a half tracker, Shafiq tried to help it along with the angle into him, it seemed to stick in the surface which meant Shafiq was through the stroke a fraction early, which resulted in a top edge safely taken at fine leg
full and straight, kept out, pushed into the off side, and they take one
length around off, punched to point
full outside off, driven to mid-off
length outside off, he goes feeling for it as rears disconcertingly, beaten
full and angled in, nudged to fine leg for one
fired across him, defends from the crease
tossed up this time, Shaheen takes the invitation, goes down on one knee and picks him up towards deep square leg for four

four for Embuldeniya and a brilliant catch from Mathews! It was tossed up and angled across this time, Shaheen came dancing down to launch over the leg side, got a massive top edge, Mathews had to run back from mid-off, which is never easy but he kept his eyes on the steepler throughout, and finally put in a dive to hold on
length, zips back in but from middle. Would have swung down leg, but there is some movement on offer for Afridi straight away
down the leg side, and Fernando looks to whip this away. Off the pad, and through to fine leg for four
fuller, from outside off, swinging back in, and he presses forward to defend this close to his left toe
fuller, and driven straight back down the ground. Beats Afridi in his follow through, and mid-on has to pedal back towards the fence and pull this back
short, and he somehow negotiates it well. Takes his hand off and allows this to go off his arm towards square leg. Short leg goes to his right to field, but they pinch a single
length, swings away from outside off, and he leaves
presses forward to defend a delivery on a length just around off
length, just around off, and he presses forward to defend
strays down the pads, and Fernando looks to whip this away. Off his pads to the right of square leg. Karunaratne wants the leg bye, and makes it quite easily
length, just around off, and he defends this from the crease without much ado
short, a bit wide, and he drives this but cannot place it well enough. Straight along the ground to point
a jaffa! Angles across him from a good length and beats him. He looks for a defensive prod, and misses out on connection
length, angles in towards the pads, and he looks to flick. Off the pad, and pops up towards square leg. They get a single

full, wide of off, and he looks to drive. Off the edge, and runs away between the gap between third slip and gully. Uppish, to be fair, and would probably have needed an exceptional catch from fourth slip, had he been there
length, and he defends from the crease
length, outside off, and he lets this pass
length, outside off, nibbles further away and he leaves

fuller, just outside off, and he looks to play straight. Almost falls over, and ends up skewing a shot towards cover. Fielded by the fieldsman away to his right. Good bowling from Afridi, who is looking to get him to over-balance
length, and he presses forward to defend this towards short mid-wicket
length, outside off, nips away a touch. Left alone by Fernando
length, and he comes forward to drop this dead at his feet
Fernando presses forward to defend a length ball on the line of off
length, just around off, nibbles away. Fernando has a tentative poke at it, and is beaten!
length, and he presses forward and defends compactly
length, just around off, nips back in, and Karunaratne defends. Seems a little unsure of which way to go with his feet. He's not enjoying facing Afridi at all

fuller, wider, and he drives with bat away from body! Flies off the edge and goes through the point region. Well played, you have to admit, as he knew where he wanted to put this. Square enough past gully and fine enough past the man at the point position
length, around off, and defends from the crease
fuller, a touch of swing away, and Karunaratne overbalances a touch again! Off the outer part of the bat, but he does well to keep it down. Through towards gully
full, outside off, and he presses forward a bit better. Drives towards mid-off
full, angles in to the stumps, looking for that leg before, but Karunaratne does well to flick this away towards long leg
length around off, and he defends with a slight forward press
length, but angles down leg. He plays this late, and keeps it low to get it down towards fine leg
length, angles across him, and he plays it with a straight bat towards cover
length, and he goes back and punches this towards point. Bowled at 127.8kph
full, and just around off, and he leans into this. Gorgeous, as it goes past Abbas and hurries through to the long-off boundary
length, and he flicks this wide of square leg. Some hard running fetches them two easily
short of a length, angles across him, and he drops his wrist to let this get out of the way

full, wide, and he drives for this. Pakistan review for caught behind, but it's not been given! Seems to have beaten him at first glance, but Rizwan is convinced there is a feather edge. Good length, and lured him in to a drive, with his front leg going nowhere. They are seeing a spike as the ball passes! That's the first breakthrough, and terrific bowling from Afridi
length, just around off and middle, and he has to defend this after getting behind the line. Precise start from the bowler
full, angles away from him. He looks to drive, and chops it on to his front leg. Drops dead just by his feet
length, outside off, and he leaves it alone
fuller, a touch wider, and he drives this. Cut off by mid-off, diving away to his right
length, angles away from him, and he defends from the crease, hopping to ride the bounce on offer
full, just across him, and beats him for pace as well as movement. Karunaratne is late with his attempted drive, as it thuds through to Rizwan. Delivered at 143kph
length, but starts from wide of off, and he can leave this alone. Cranked up to 143.6kph
a bit shorter, and he looks to flog this through the off side. Beaten for pace again, as it hurries through with some pace to Rizwan
length, straighter, and he can whip this towards mid-wicket. Abbas has some running across to do to his left, and they take an easy single
length, just outside off, and bounces further away through to Rizwan. Went at 144.4kph

that could be close! Fullish ball, and strikes him on the pad, but the angle would probably have taken it down leg, as Karunaratne played back. Not given, and Afridi is talked out of reviewing this by his senior colleagues
full, slanting down leg, and he flicks this away towards long leg
full, angles across and he leaves
short, and he swivel-pulls this towards square leg. Hurries on to him a touch, and he can only get it towards deep square leg
length, and he lets it angle across him. A bit of late swing back in, but comfortably after crossing the batsman
length, straight, and he defends with a straight bat
full, wide, and he leans into a gorgeous extra cover drive. Vacant slot there, and that's where Karunaratne cashes in, with a big stride to get close to the ball. Right off the middle
beaten! Just got the length to pull back a touch, and angles it across him. Karunaratne has a poke at it, but fails to make contact. Good, fast bowling
short, and wide, and he leaves. Delivered at 145kph, but the direction could have been much better
a touch short and he looks to cut this away. Cannot beat point, though
beauty! Angles away from him with good pace again, and he can't lay a bat on it, looking for a defensive prod
length, and he looks to defend from the crease. From the inside of the bat towards short mid-wicket
length, around off, and he presses forward to defend
length, but down the legside. Easy put away towards long leg
length, around off, and he plays it away towards point with the angle across him
length, nibbles across him from outside off, and he leaves
fuller, just around off, and he drives this to mid-off
length, outside off, bounces away as it seams across him, and he leaves
length, but down the pads, and he whips it away towards square-leg. Easy single as the fielder has to go across to his left
dug in short, and he ducks under this one. Fast and well-directed, as it forces Karunaratne to let it go across, and keep his bat as low as possible
back of a length, angles across him, and he defends from the crease
length, just around off, and he defends, pressing forward a touch
length, and he flicks this to the left of mid-on. Afridi goes across quickly and stops this from getting past him, but he cannot prevent an easy single
length, just around off, with a bit of seam movement away. Defended from the crease itself
length, across him, and he leaves

oh, he's played on! FDM will be disappointed with that, as it wasn't the best ball bowled yet. Abbas gets one to just grip a bit around off, and he looks to cut one that was far too close for that shot. Off the inside edge, and goes on to rattle timber. Timely wicket for Pakistan
length and probing away around off, Mathews gets nicely behind the line, back and across and defends
length around off again, nips back as Mathews shuffles again and tucks it around to deep square leg's right for a couple to get underway
squares him up with a legcutter! Same length, around off, Mathews shuffled and closed the face early, the thick edge bisected the cordon
this one keeps a tad low from a length, it was on the stumps also, Mathews does well to keep it out
short one, wasted delivery so far outside off, left alone
length and nipping back in, Mendis pushes it towards midwicket
full on the pads, that's Mendis' favoured area, clips it straight to deep backward square leg on this occasion, only for one
full around off, good length to Mathews who likes to hang back, pushed into the off side for a quick single
length on the pads, pushed to midwicket
that's fuller and angling in, Mendis drives but drives a little early reaching out with his hands a little but manages to find the gap between midwicket and mid-on for three
great length, drawing him forward, around off, lunges and defends
same length again and he's getting it to nibble a little either way, this one was a leg cutter and nearly induced a leading edge as Mendis defended on the walk, keen to get to the ball
slightly shorter and much wider, left alone
length on middle, behind that nicely, defends back to the bowler
lovely leg cutter, teasing line and length beats the outside edge! Mendis is keen to get the ball but the length is always slightly shorter than he expects, shapes away after pitching
straighter this time, slightly shorter, defended more confidently. Probing over
short and wild, rather than wide, wayyyyyy down the leg side, the keeper saw it early but had no chance
much better, fuller and outside off, left alone by Mathews, who is hanging back as usual
length outside off, slight shape away after pitching, left alone
length on middle, nicely behind that and defends
length and nipping back in, Mathews tucks it away to deep backward square leg for one
length again, pitches around middle and off before nipping back in, nudged to deep backward square leg for one
length outside off, too wide and left alone
short and wide, unlike Abbas, Mendis pounces on it, goes hard and up and over point for four

great ball and an excellent catch at slip! It's the legcutter again, Mendis goes searching for it with his hands as it isn't full enough, nips away as he makes contact, taking the edge and carrying quite low to Haris Sohail at slip, who had his fingers underneath the ball, by the look of it. Mendis, unsure, stands his ground, but the replays confirm it was a clean catch and Pakistan are well and truly back into the game now
length around middle, Embuldeniya defends but the bounce beats him, strikes him on the thigh as the ball lobs up to short leg
short one, he knew very little about that as he took his eyes off it but left his bat hanging, and even at Abbas' pace, it was well directed, just eludes his gloves
comes around the wicket, angled it in and takes it away off the seam, beats the outside edge
full around off, slight shape back in as Mathews defends
shorter and angled across, too easy for Mathews who is happy to not have to play at deliveries
fuller and on the stumps, pushed into the leg side
floated up around off, there was a hint of late movement away, defended
length and angled across, left alone
length around off, safely negotiated as he defends to the off side
angled in from around the wicket, only has to straighten from there to trouble the left hander, beats the bat
full and angled in, defends to mid-off
length, angled in, edged but along the ground to third slip
length and probing away around off, defended from the crease
short one, angled in, handles this alright, sways out of the way
full around off, he reaches out with just his hands, checked the stroke in the end to elude the short cover and they come through for three
wide on the crease, length outside off, left alone
wide on the crease, loud cry of no ball, for front foot, length outside off again, perhaps wider than the last and left alone
goes fuller and closer to off stump, beats the bat, with Embuldeniya fishing from the crease
full and close to off again, flirts at it from the crease and squirts it away towards the cordon, all along the ground, so no harm
short one, too wide, left alone
this one's perfect, it's full, fast and straight, going for the toes, brings his bat down just in time to keep it out
another short one, but too wide and high to trouble the nightwatchman who lets it go
perfect straight up, gentle delivery but on the money, length that hits the top of off, in the channel, Mathews hangs back and guides it along the ground to the cordon

short and wide, very unlike Abbas, Mathews has an equally uncharacteristic slash it and is beaten. It was there for the shot but Mathews has hardly played a shot so far in this innings, here he went at it on instinct and missed
immediately makes the correction, length around middle and off, squares Mathews up as he defends
fuller this time, again on off, Mathews opens the face and guides it along the ground to gully
fullish again, just around off stump again, Mathews hangs back as he tends to, defends as he is nearly squared up again
little shorter around off, more comfortable this for Mathews, pushes it to cover
fullish ball outside off, Embuldeniya pushes at it from the crease and finds the gap through covers with decent timing for two
length outside off, hint of width and he uses Naseem's pace to guide it through the cordon for an easy two

knocked him over? No, in fact it's narrowly, inexplicably missed the stumps! It was a length ball that jagged back sharply and burst through the gate before taking a bit of the inside edge, flicking the flap of the pad, but went over the stumps to even beat the diving keeper with the exaggerated movement
gets this one to move away off the seam from a similar area, beats the bat
dropped! Squared him up, induced a thick edge that carried comfortably to gully, but put down by Babar Azam, who grabbed at it, rather than let it settle into his waiting his hands. Hard hands
length outside off, defends with an angled bat
full around off, hangs back and defends
length on middle, defended
full outside off, Mathews somewhat comes forward and defends
length outside off, too wide to tempt him

beauty, beats him! Probes away around the off stump, this is nice and up to the bat and a particularly good ball to someone who liked to hang back, cuts away off the seam and narrowly eludes the outside edge
length on middle, nudged to the leg side
length outside off from wide on the crease, Embuldeniya is expecting it to come in with angle, leaves him again
this one's on the stumps from the same wide angle, manages to bring his bat down and keep it out
this one's fuller around off, crunches it to cover, timing it surprisingly well but straight to the man
short one, it was coming at him with the angle, but does well to get out of its way
length and angled in, made a horrible sound off the bat as Embuldeniya pushed with just his hands, managed to get it between point and cover for a couple
length, angled in, Embuldeniya plays inside the line and is beaten
continues probing away on that length and line around off, Mathews skips down the wicket and defends, it's a teasing length
he was shaping to step down again, keen to get closer to the ball, the length as Mendis found out yesterday is never quite full enough, , this one's a bit wider and left alone

more poor fielding costs Pakistan, this was straighter, Mathews clipped it through midwicket and called for two, there was some hesitation which would have had Embuldeniya in deep trouble at the non striker's end on the second run but a wild throw saves him
length around off, pushed into the off side for a quick single
length around off from around the wicket, opens the face and defends to point
angled in from around again, opens the face and guides it to point again
length outside off, left alone by Mathews
length outside off, Mathews seemingly enjoying Naseem's pace a little more, pushes this into the covers
fuller around off, opens the face and runs it to backward point, That's a better length to Mathews, who likes to hang back
again full around off, Mathews is reluctant to come forward, he takes half a step and defends
length around off again, nips back in a little and hurries Mathews for pace as he gets a bit of an inside edge on to the pad
short and wide, poor ball, Mathews cuts but straight to point on the bounce
short one from Abbas, nice change up, great line, right at the nightwatchman who ducks under awkwardly
another snorter, well directed bouncer, kept coming at him, Embuldeniya was half ducking with his bat hanging above his head

what's happened there? It's tremendous bowling and anticipation from Abbas who has sneaked in a slower ball, out of nowhere but perhaps rattled by the two short ones, Embuldeniya has an ugly swipe across the line ends up swinging too early and getting a leading edge to the slips, where this time there's no error. finally a breakthrough for Pakistan
full around off, nice stride forward and defended
length around off, stays back this time and defends into the off side
length around off, back to the probing line and length, Chandimal stays back and defends under his eyes
length ball but too straight and slides down
length around off, this one kicks back at Mathews, who does well to drop his bottom hand and control it even though he was taken by surprise
goes full on the stumps as a follow up, driven wide of mid-on where Naseem does well diving to his right to keep them to one
full outside off, overcooked, but Chandimal plays slight outside the line and pushes it back to the bowler
this one's on a length around middle and off and kicks back at Chandimal disconcertingly, takes it on the body
short and angled way across, left alone safely
length around off, defends from the crease
strays in line, slides on to the pads, pretty rare, tucked away to deep backward square leg, but only for one
length around off, gets it nips back in slightly, Chandimal defends to midwicket with a closed face
full around off, great length, drawing him forward but with Abbas, much like a spinner, it's often not quite full enough even if it looks like it, safely negotiated, though
length around off, defended to the off side from the crease
full around off, defended into the covers

Shaheen strikes It's Mathews, the big fish, he had fought hard but perishes. It was a length ball, angled across but just seemed to nip back belatedly, Mathews played outside the line, for the original angle across him and ended up getting an inside edge back to the keeper. Pakistan, perhaps for the first time in Test match, are well and truly on top
length around off, defended from the crease.
length around off, comes forward and defends
ull and angled across, leans nicely into it and drives to cover.
f .fuller and angled across, left alone
shorter, angled across, he drops his hands and watches it through to the keeper
length on middle, defended
full around off, defends into the off side, slightly hesitant to come forward, Chandimal
full around off, comes forward this time and defends
short and well directed, at the body of Chadimal, sways out of the way
length outside off, punches it through cover point to get off the mark
length around off, defended
length around off, pushed into the covers
length, angled across, left alone
length and angled across again, left alone
shorter and same angle, he throws his hands at this one without getting across with his backfoot at all, beaten by the extra bounce
through him! Length around off, jags back sharply off the seam, Chandimal plays outside the line and it bursts through the gap between bat and pad but the bounce takes it over
length and outside off, not a lot of width and plenty of extra bounce, but Chandimal slashes hard and clears gully on this occasion. He is under pressure here, the stroke wasn't quite on
length and strays in line a little, tickled off the pad down to fine leg
length around off, comes forward and defends
length around off, defended
length outside off, bit of width and Chandimal creams this through cover point, on top of the bounce and it races away to the fence
strays on to the pads, Chandimal whips it away through midwicket, Shaheen chases from mid-on and keeps it in play with a slide at the boundary
length and strays on to the pads again, he shuffles across and tickled it fine
length around off, straightening off the seam a little, defended from the crease
slightly shorter and angled across, gets right behind it and defends solidly
length, angling across, behind it again and defends with a slightly open face into the off side
fuller and angling across this time, he pushes hard with mostly his hands, squirts it away though gully off a thick outside edge
length around off and cutting back in slightly, defended from the crease
fuller and angling across, driven to mid-on without much timing
drops it slightly short, pushed to deep cover-point
good ball, fuller, drew him forward and bounced a bit more as he defended, no silly point, now he's in
drops it short, he rocks back and pushes it to the sweeper on the off side
length around middle, goes back and defends
nice, full around off, comes forward and defends
nice drift there, full around middle, comes forward and defends
length around off, shuffles a little and defends with a closed face towards midwicket
short and fast, at the body, really surprised him as it hurried on over his right shoulder, he pulled with no conviction but top edge fell in no man's land to the left of the keeper
length around off, defended from the crease
length and angling across, defended towards mid-off
length and angled across, left alone this time
cuts him in half, it wasn't one that jags back sharply, it went across him but Chandimal played outside the line
nice drift again, length around middle and leg, defended into the leg side
lovely drift again, full around middle, opens up his front leg and pushes it to long-off
full around off, quicker this time, comes forward and defends
flatter one around off, a little short, cut away to the sweeper for one
comes down, Yasir shortens his length, he defends back
was shaping come down again, maybe just to put Yasir off, drops it slightly shorter again, pushed into the off side for one
too full, just outside off and driven solidly towards the bowler. The ball hits Naseem's right heel that keeps it to two
pitched up once again, pushed towards extra cover this time
length ball around off, goes back and works it towards long-on. Was deep in his crease and had to sprint to make his ground
another inside edge that evades the stumps. Was on the fuller side once again, Chandimal comes forward and looks to push hard. The ball swings in but once again no luck for Naseem
much better this time, bat and pad close and looking to defend instead of pushing. Meets the bat right in the middle
a bouncer to end the over with but too short. Chandimal spots it early and ducks under
playing back to a fuller one. Was looking to cut but no width as well. Gets beaten
flatter around off, steered towards point from the back foot
a touch short this time and Dhananjaya manages to punch it towards deep extra cover
tossed up on middle and leg, drives it inside out, just to the left of Yasir for a quick single
tossed up on the leg stump. Defend towards the leg side, Chandimal was keen for a single but Dhananjaya sends him back
slides on from middle and leg, Dhananjaya was once again on the back foot, defends it towards long-on
length outside off, stands tall and chops it towards covers
139.8kph, a bouncer from Naseem. Chandimal was looking to pull it initially but it's too high and he evades it in the end
another short one, down the leg side this time, Chandimal goes for the pull with deep square leg in place, goes over the gloves. An appeal for caught-behind but not out
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
length ball around off, stays back and defends it towards covers
length ball outside off, cuts it towards deep point
short enough on middle and leg for Dhananjaya to rock back and pull it towards the vacant deep midwicket area
fuller on middle and leg, plays inside out and drives it towards extra cover
skids off the surface this time, length ball around off, Dhananjaya has been camping on the back foot. Looks to cut it away but gets an inside edge into the ground
flighted at the batsman, Dhananjaya comes forward and offers a dead-bat
length ball on the pads, glanced towards fine leg
fuller around off, leans forward and defends
length ball outside off, stays back and pushes it square of the wicket on the off side
another bouncer from Naseem, on middle and leg, Chandimal bends to let it go over his left shoulder
short again but well outside off, ignored again
length outside off, left alone but Naseem has overstepped. A big no-ball
short of length outside off, stays back and punches it past cover for a quick brace
fuller around off, looks for a drive through covers but gets a thick inside edge towards midwicket. They were looking for the second once again but only one this time
Dhananjaya takes on the short ball, pulls it towards deep-backward square leg, was in the air but well short of the fielder in the deep who makes a diving stop
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards extra cover
uses his feet and launches it cleanly over the bowler's head, all the way for a six
fuller around off, pushed towards short extra cover
fuller but Dhananjaya was once again on the back foot, defended in the end
a touch short and Dhananjaya punches it through covers, beats the man at cover for four more
fuller outside off, a bit flatter as well. Dhananjaya pushes at it half-heartedly and gets beaten
length ball outside off, a big swing away from the batsman who leaves it alone
length ball around off, mistimes the drive towards mid-on
length ball around off, stays back and punches it towards extra cover
fuller around off, pushes it towards mid-off from the crease
a bit fuller outside off, a big front-foot stride and driven almost on the up, through extra cover for four
length outside off, left alone
fuller around off and middle, drives it towards cover
length ball on the pads, goes back and wrists it behind square leg
fuller on the stumps, driven towards mid-off, Chandimal was sprinting towards the other end but Dhananjaya sends him back in time
fuller outside off, pushed towards cover for an easy single
fuller, flighted and at the stumps, pushed back
pitched up on middle and leg, digs it out back towards the bowler
length ball around off, stays back and punches it towards mid-off
fuller on the pads, flicks it towards short midwicket for a single
length ball on middle and leg, flicked towards square leg. Was looking for a single but the fielder was quick to the ball
length ball around off, stays back and defends it on the leg side
length ball around off, stays back and blocks again
length ball around off, stays beside the line of the ball and defends it towards point
length ball on the stumps, flicked away towards midwicket
fuller outside off, goes for the drive but gets a thick outside edge past first slip
pitched up on the stumps, flicked towards midwicket
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards mid-on
fuller outside off, drives it towards mid-off, another dot
fuller again, comes forward and drives it towards mid-off
length ball around off, stays back and dabs it towards gully
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards the right of mid-on

length outside off, swings away from the batsman, left alone
length outside off, looks to push at it and gets beaten
length ball around off, stays in his crease and pushes it towards cover-point, playing with his hands

length ball around off, stays back and defends

short of length outside off, stays back and cuts it over backward point, only 35 behind now

such a great delivery but no rewards for it. Will go down as a dot ball in the scoresheet. Length ball around middle and off, swing back in to cut the batsman in half. Brushes the back leg and into the keeper's gloves. No bat, too high for the lbw
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it towards mid-off
length ball around off, goes back and works it towards mid-on

fuller around off, comes forward and dead-bats it

a full toss on the stumps, goes for the reverse sweep but finds short third man
length ball in the corridor, left alone
length ball around fifth stump, going with the angle. Shouldered arms
length ball, at the batsman, flicked towards square leg
just evades the flying second slip. Was a length ball outside off, Dickwella pushes at it, gets a healthy outside edge. Shafiq goes to his left but more with his right hand. Cannot reach there
another outside edge but into the ground this time. Was a length ball outside off, looks to defend. Beats the gully fielder
fuller outside off, looks to scoop it over the keeper's head but makes no contact
length ball around off, comes forward and defends it towards mid-off
length ball on the stumps, angling down, Chandimal looks to flick, gets an inside edge on to the pads
length ball around off, comes forward and defends

length ball outside off, punches it towards mid-off from the back foot
length ball around off, stays back and defends on the off side

fuller around off, moves across and flicks it to the left of mid-on

length ball outside off, punches it towards mid-on

fuller outside off, punched firmly but straight to the cover fielder

length ball on the pads, flicked towards square leg

cuts him in half straight up, has done that quite consistently through the innings, got it to jag back in from outside off, and through the defences

length outside off, left alone
length on around off, little shuffle, comes forward and defends

crucial crucial runs, a little needless from the gully fielder who had a go at the non striker's end after Dickwella pushed the full ball in his direction and took off, the throw was off target and he would have made it in any case
length around off, shuffles, takes a couple of steps down the wicket and defends
length outside off, driven crisply on the up but straight to cover
through him, length outside off, Dickwella played outside the line and was beaten on the inside edge as the ball kept a little low
length outside off, pushed to point
length outside off, Dickwella takes a couple steps down and opens the face to get it through the covers, the timing's good and that's another four
length on around middle and off, Dickwella defends to mid-on
inside edge but back on to the pad, it was a length ball angled across, Chandimal wanted to drive on the up, survives another close call after lunch
length around off, more solid in defence this time
length and angled across around off, stays back and defends
short one over middle and leg, a little too high maybe, Chandimal ducks under after initially shaping to hook
fuller around off this time, he comes forward and drives to mid-off

length around off, pushed into the covers
short outside off, Chandimal tries to flat bat this through the covers, doesn't time it and the fielder does well diving to his left. They take one, however
length outside off, Dickwella shuffles and gets outside the line as he struck on the thigh. He is standing well outside his crease for the purpose, in the first place

the keeper comes up to keep Dickwella in the crease and it works straight away! It's a length ball around off, doesn't do much off the wicket, just comes in with the natural angle, Dickwella pushes forward tentatively and the ball bursts through the gap between bat and pad to rattle the woodwork. Four for Abbas, Sri Lanka still seven away
length on around middle, defends
big appeal for lbw but pretty optimistic by the look of it, it was a length ball around leg stump, and struck Chandima on the knee roll, but pitched outside
length around off, defended
another close shout as Chandimal falls over and is struck on the thigh for the ball to balloon up towards the slips
length around off, defended
fuller on the pads, Chandimal misses a scoring option there as he is struck on the thigh again
length around off, Perera fishes and is beaten by the hint of away movement
action replay, even better ball actually, this one was closer to off, he had to play it at, beaten by the leg cutter but saved by the extra bounce
length around off, defended with an open face
goes straighter and slightly fuller, Perera was falling over but just managed to get his bat around the front pad
again full around off, nips back in as Perera defends on the front foot

short one, a bit high, Perera ducks under
length outside off, Perera hangs his bat out tentatively and pushes it to mid-off
fuller around off, hint of nip back into him, comes forward and defends
length outside off, pushed it wide of point and they come through for one to inch closer to Pakistan's total

changes the angle and comes around, strays onto the pads and it's clipped through square leg with the angle for two as Sri Lanka draw level
full on middle, pushed to mid-on
comes back over, length on middle and off, defended back to the bowler

length outside off, stands tall, on top of the bounce, punches it through extra cover to bring up a little scratchy but hugely important fifty. Great shot, that. Perhaps not the kind of pitch that allows fluent run scoring either
full around off, Chandimal nearly falls over as he defends back to the bowler
length around off, defended
length around off, pushed into the off side
fuller but drifts on to the pads, Chandimal clips it through midwicket with control and gets two

full on off, driven to mid-off

length outside off, shoulders arms

another yorker-length delivery from Yasir. Jams his bat at it
much better, full but not too full. On middle and leg, a thick outside edge towards short third man

fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks

short but not high enough. Pulled away by Chandimal, smashed to the deep square leg boundary

fuller around off, defended from the front foot

too full outside off, bunted back to Yasir
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the pads, looks to glance but misses. A leg bye to short fine leg
fuller on the stumps, drives inside out towards covers
goes for the cut but the ball keeps coming in with the arm, an inside edge to fine leg

length ball on the pads, looks to flick but misses. Shouts of catch it but it's off the pad
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks

I think it touched the grass before Shafiq pouched it. After multiple replays, checking frame by frame and zooming in, it's still not clear if he caught it cleanly. Gregory Brathwaite finally deems it touched the ground. Not out and Yasir remains wicketless for now
fuller outside off, smothers it
length ball wide outside off, pushes at it and keeps it away
uses his feet, reaches to the pitch of the ball and smokes it over the bowler's head

fuller on the stumps, flicked uppishly to the right of Naseem at mid-on. Naseem puts in the chase but the ball beats him to boundary

length ball outside off, angling in to the batsman to beat the inside edge and rap him on the pads. A loud appeal for lbw but denied. Shaheen convinces Azhar to review it. No inside edge there but it would have just clipped the bails. Umpire's call on the stumps and Dilruwan survives

length ball outside off, looks to push on the off side, the ball hits the toe-end of the bat and dribbles towards the slip. A fumble there and they sneak in a single. A direct hit at the keeper's end though would have been curtains for Fernando
Fernando survives the one ball. It was length outside off and he pushed it away towards point
skips down the track and goes leg side. Doesn't middle it but the ball travels towards deep midwicket. Denies the single though
fuller around off, defended this time
use of feet once again and this time punches it towards long-on with a straight bat. Doesn't take the single
length ball around off, defends it towards covers and sets off
a bouncer from Abbas but Fernando sways away from it in time

a bouncer to Dilruwan who ducks under but Shaheen has stepped over

another one, actions replay, banged in, it was coming for him, he evades it in ungainly but effective fashion again

fuller around off, nips back a little, pushed into the leg side, there's a possibility of two but one is all they'll get and Abbas has Fernando on  strike

appeal for lbw as Fernando is struck on the pad but it was too leg side and aborted pretty quickly

straying on to the pads and tickled away towards fine leg for four

pulls his length back just a little, Abid still comes forward and defends

around middle and off this time and pulls his length back a touch, pushed to mid-on

pulls his length back just a touch, same line, Abid waits a little longer and defends

picks up the length quickly here, goes down on one knee and drags the sweep from outside off, up and over the square leg region for another four
full on off, defended

full on middle and leg, hint of drift in, pushed to mid-on

pitched up around off, drives it towards deep extra cover
length ball on the stumps, tucked away in front of square leg
a low full toss on the pads, flicked away towards deep midwicket. Comes back for the third

fuller on the stumps, pushed towards short midwicket
pitched up again, drives it towards long-on

on the pads, flicked away behind square leg. They are coming back for the second and complete easily. The bowler wasn't in the position to collect the throw and that results in an overthrow
length ball around off, defended
length again, slower in the air, goes back and works it towards square leg

gets to his fifty with that. Too full this time and driven towards deep extra cover

length outside off, spin and bounce. Azhar was looking to cut it away but withdraws in the end
length ball outside off, left alone
fuller on the pads, flicked towards midwicket
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-on
fuller around off, lunges forward to block
fuller around off, comes forward and works it towards square leg
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg for another single
length ball on the pads, looks to defend but misses
fuller, just around the off stump. Azhar was on the back foot and decides to leave. Just spins past the off stump
fuller again, sweeps it from outside off for a single to deep square leg
turn and bounce from outside off, Babar was looking to defend and gets beaten
fuller around off, defended towards the bowler
pitched up around off, comes forward and drives it towards point
fuller around off, driven towards long-on for a walking single
short of length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller around off, drops it on the off side and looks for a single but both keeper and slip were quick to the ball
fuller on the pads, pushes it on the leg side
pitched up on the pads, flicked towards square leg
length ball angling away, looks to push and gets beaten
fuller around off, digs it out towards the bowler

fuller around middle and leg, defended
length ball around off, goes back and punches it towards point
full on middle and leg, nudges it towards square leg
pitched up outside off, drives it towards deep extra cover
tossed up at the stumps, comes forward and blocks
uses his feet and pushes it back towards the bowler
length ball on the pads, glanced towards short fine leg
too full around off, turns it in front of square leg

length ball around off, lunges forward and defends

fuller around off, pushed back
length ball at the pads, defended again
fuller around middle and off, bowled wide of the crease this time. Blocked
tossed up just outside off, comes forward before shouldering arms

pitched up around off, comes forward and defends
fuller, wide outside off. Left alone by Babar
length but even wider. Ignored again
fuller around off, a bit of swing back into the batsman, flicked away towards mid-on
short of length outside off, hops in the air and tucks it away towards short midwicket

short of length outside off and Babar just stands tall and punches it towards deep extra cover. Sweeper manages to just cut it off
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards deep cover

tossed up around off, comes forward and defends

good short one to finish the over with. Angling in at the batsman but Azhar does well to bend and sway away from it
a full toss around off, but Babar fails to put it away. Drives it straight towards mid-off

length ball around off, comes forward and defends again
fuller around off, lunges forward and dead-bats

given lbw, Babar reluctantly chooses to review. Was a length ball around off and middle and kept coming in with the angle. Babar looked to defend but replay shows there was an inside edge. But it looked like Babar wasn't sure if he got any bat on it. A loud cheer from the crowd as the on-field umpire changed his decision
short of length around off, defended on the off side

fuller and wider outside off, Babar goes for the drive, opening the face at the point of contact to place it wide of the cover fielder. Oshada chases it from deep cover, flicks it back but batsmen run four by themselves
length ball around off, stays back and flicks it towards square leg
fuller around off, comes forward and opens the face of the bat at the point of contact to run it between second slip and gully
fuller around off, skips down the track and drives it towards the left of Mathews at mid-off, who dives to his left to stop a certain boundary
fuller on the stumps, turned away towards short midwicket
length ball around off, comes forward and defends with soft hands
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards mid-on for a quick single
