short of length around off, stays back and works it towards mid-on
length ball around off, works it towards point for one
short of length outside off, pushes it towards deep point
a short one just outside off, Babar sways away from it
another bouncer, just around the off stump. Babar ducks under without any issues
length ball, wide outside off. Babar goes for the cut but misses. He's not happy with himself
fuller, just outside off. Azhar was on the back foot and leaves it alone
pitched up outside off, goes for the sweep, gets a top edge but it lands well in front of deep-backward square leg
length ball around off, pushes it towards cover and sets off. Good running once again
tossed up outside off, lunges forward and drives it towards deep extra cover
fuller and wider outside off, paddled towards deep-backward square leg
short of length and spinning away, cuts it towards deep extra cover
length ball around middle, comes back in to surprise Azhar who was shaping up to play a cut. The ball cuts him in half and hits him near the chest. Azhar is withering in pain
fuller around off, comes forward and flicks it towards short midwicket
length ball around off, comes forward and drops it near his feet
fuller on the pads, flicked away towards deep-backward square leg
length ball outside off, opens the face of the bat to guide it behind point. For a moment, the batsmen thought there was a chance of a second run but the fielder was quick to the ball
length outside off, pushes it towards point where the fielder gets a hand on it but cannot prevent the single
fuller outside off, a bit of flight from Embuldeniya. Drives it towards point where the fielder makes a tumbling stop
flatter and quicker at the stumps, makes room and pushes it towards deep extra cover
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it on the leg side
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
tossed up teasingly outside off, gets Babar to push at it, the ball takes the outer half and rolls towards point
padded away this time. Fuller but outside off, and would have missed the stumps. The umpire ignores the highly optimistic lbw appeal
length ball outside off, dabs it behind point and sprints back for the second
fuller around off, nudges it on the off side and looks to sneak in a single. But the fielder was right next to the ball
length ball on the pads, tucked towards short midwicket
short and wide and cuts it through the point region. The sweeper cover puts in the slide but the ball beats him for four
fuller and angling away from the batsman, left alone
fuller at the batsman, punched back but Vishwa gets a hand to it
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller outside off, Babar moves across and laps it fine. 450 comes up with the boundary, Babar moves to 48
down the track but gets too close to the ball. Also it was bowled on the pads, nudges it towards short midwicket
tossed up outside off, Babar comes forward to defend, bat and pad next to each other but misses. An appeal for lbw but not out
use of feet to take it on the full, puts it wide of long-on for a couple to bring up his half-century
length ball outside off, dips at the batsman, Babar ends up pushing it towards point
fuller and angling away, driven on the front foot but cannot beat the cover fielder

four more to Azhar, delicate touch this time. Short of length outside off, he waits for it before opening the face and guiding it between the lone slip and gully
make that three in a row. Short of length ball, too much room outside off and Azhar late cuts it again to move to 98
length but too far away from the batsman, left alone
length ball around off, stays back and defends
short and wide, goes back and cuts but there is a sweeper in place

that's the 16th Test hundred for Azhar Ali. Short and wide once again, Azhar cuts it past the diving point fielder and hares back for the second. Off comes the helmet. A hug from Babar. A standing ovation from his team-mates
fuller around off, pushes it towards cover-point
a mistimed slog sweep towards deep square leg, gets a couple
length ball around off, punched back towards the bowler
tossed up around off, lunges forward and blocks
full and angled across from around, pushed back

flat and quick on middle, defended back

length on the pads, flatter delivery, nudged through square leg for one

full on middle, pushed to midwicket's right for one

length on middle, works it straight to midwicket again

skips down too early, Perera fires it on the pads, tucks it away through square leg for one
full outside off, pushes it into the off side for an easy single
length on the pads tucked away to deep backward square leg for one
full and sliding down, Babar comes down hard on it to sweep it fine, gets a bit of glove before it nearly rolls back on to the stumps, saved by the second line of defence
full and angled in again, not the ball to sweep but the makes some connection and finds the gap, it's an inside edge that goes right through his legs and trickles away to the fine leg boundary
full around off, pushed through the covers for two
full around off, defended

full around off, defended
Babar's not hanging around here, goes down on one knee and hammers it flat and hard into the stands at deep square leg
this one's fired outside off as he comes down the wicket, loses his shape as he looks to smash it out of Karachi but saved by an outside edge that trickles away to the third man fence
full on middle and leg, defended

skips down and misses, the keeper doesn't, takes off the bails calmly and that's the end of Azhar Ali. He's already walking even as the on field umpires go upstairs, replays confirm he was well out, the bowler saw him come early and threw it wide, the keeper does the rest. But Azhar will be satisfied with his effort and the position his team is in
tossed up outside off, pushed into the off side
tossed up outside off and off the mark in style, goes inside out over extra cover, long-off gets around to his left and cuts it off to keep them to two

fired in around leg stump seeing him advance, Babar kicks it away and remains on 99

pushes it into the off side and the Karachi crowd rises to applaud yet another hundred from Pakistan's most promising star! That's his second hundred of the series and the third in the last four Tests, punches the air, and it's only the second time that the top four batsmen have each got a hundred in the same innings

starts well here, length around off, kicks and spins away from the bat

that's a good one from Yasir, length around off, turns a little as he comes forward to defend

fuller and angled across, Mathews defends with a slightly open face but a loose bottom hand as that squirts away along the ground to gully

fuller but on the pads, clipped neatly through midwicket for two

nice one, length around middle, jumped and turned away from there, Mathews does well to watch it very closely before defending it right under his eyes

straighter line, similar length, makes room and punches this to deep cover for one

length around middle and off, squares up a little and defends to th leg side
full, tempting and angling across, doesn't take the bait, watches it through to the keeper
comes closer to the stumps to deliver, length around off, defended solidly
fullish delivery around off again, shuffles a little and defends to mid-off
shortens his length a little, just outside off, Farnando gets on his toes and defends to the off side

quicker one around middle, Mathews is looking for the cut, makes room and pushes this to point, can't beat the man
tossed up on off, driven to long-off. can't understand the point of the long-off

could have been close, but good judgement, you'd have to say, it was on a length and tantalizingly close to off stump, but he left it alone to cause some excitement behind the stumps
full and angling across, pushed into the off side
has a flirt outside off and is beaten! It was a really nice length, not quite there for the drive but tempting him with the angle, Mathews was lured into a poke but survives
much fuller and straighter, pushed to mid-on

edged and taken, and that's the big fish, Mathews! They check first for the no-ball then to see if it's a clean catch, it's not a no-ball, and he seems to have his hands underneath the ball. Yes, the third umpire is convinced and Mathews walks back, massive blow to Sri Lanka

shorter and straighter, has Chandimal on the hop as he defends. He isn't the best player of the short ball, so worth testing him with a few early in his innings

fired in towards the leg stump, he was shaping to sweep but it bounced a little extra but manages to get enough bat and scoop it past the keeper

slower and shorter, ample time to rock back and defend
fuller outside off, similar pace, quite slow, driven to the left of mid-off who does well
a little quicker and straighter, comes forward and defends

quicker and full around off, defended into the covers again
full and sliding down, swept fine for one
quicker, flatter and angled in again, slides down leg, keeper does well to collect it as it keeps low
full outside off, defended
full and angled, squeezed out by Chandimal
full and angled in, Chandimal pushes it to the right of mid-on and takes off, throw comes at the non striker's end and hits bulls eye but the Fernando was well in by then
length and drfiting in again, slides down the leg side as it keeps a tad low again
full on middle and off, defended
tossed up outside off, driven without much timing to the right of extra cover and they scamper through for a single
slower and slightly shorter, hint of turn as he defends
slowish again, length around off, defends on the front foot
length outside off, he was shaping to slog him out of the park but resisted as it wasn't full enough, pushes it into the off side
tossed up outside off, reaches out for it with his hands a little but controls the extra cover driver and times it well to end the session with a boundary

length outside off, left alone by Chandimal. Swings back in after it passes the batsman
length ball around off, defended on the front foot
length around off, blocked from the front foot once again

down the leg side once again and another fine sweep from Oshada. Only a single this time though
length ball around off and middle. No turn at all. Blocked from the front foot
given lbw but reviewed straightaway. Was a length ball around off and middle, Oshada was looking to work it on the leg side, but there is a big inside edge and he survives. Decision reversed
length ball around middle and leg, tucked away past square leg for a couple
a sharp bouncer at 140.9kph. Just around the off stump but Chandimal sees it well and sways away
length ball in the corridor, shouldered arms
length ball around off, coming back in slightly, defended down the ground
length ball angling on to the pads, Chandimal misses the flick but it was going down
length ball outside off, some turn and bounce for Yasir. Left alone
flatter on middle and leg. defended on the leg side
length around off and middle, some turn once again, defended on the off side
fuller outside off, drives it towards cover but straight to the fielder
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
flatter and shorter, rocks back and pulls it towards the deep square leg boundary

a long, loud appeal for lbw, the bowler is almost pleading by the end of it but the umpire is unmoved. Pakistan choose to review. It was fuller outside off, moving in after pitching to beat the bat and hit the pads in front of the middle stump. The height is no issue but there were two noises and replay shows it was front pad followed by the back pad and the ball would gone on to hit the middle stump. Naseem has his second as Chandimal, the top-scorer of Sri Lanka's first innings, walks back
goes for the yorker but it's just a little too full. Dhananjaya gets his bat down on it
length ball around off, 141.5 kph. Defended on the leg side
length ball outside off and moving in late. It's reversing. Left alone by the batsman

an outside edge but goes low to the right of Rizwan who dives full length but it lands just in front of him. Takes it one-handed but on the bounce. Was a full delivery outside off and the batsman just hung his bat out
length ball outside off, defended square of the wicket
length ball around off, cuts it late but the slip fielder dives to his right and makes a partial stop
fuller outside off, looks to slog sweep it but ends up dragging it along the ground towards midwicket
short of length outside off, punched towards extra cover
length ball outside off, left alone by the batsman

chopped on! Finally Yasir has a wicket, his team-mates have thronged him. Short of length outside, looked like a googly. Dhananjaya goes back to cut but gets an inside edge on to the off stump. Sri Lanka have lost half their side
fuller around off, comes forward and defends
a bouncer but well outside off, Fernando stays away from it
length outside off, Oshada goes for the cut but misses. Lots of oohs and aahs from the close-in fielders
length ball around off stump, gets behind it and defends
beaten again. Length, wide outside off, Oshada looks to drive on the up and misses
length ball outside off, stands tall and defends
fuller outside off, punched towards cover from the crease
tossed up outside off, pushes it down the wicket
fuller outside off, sweeps it firmly but cannot beat backward square leg
tossed up outside off, comes down the track and takes it on the full. Pushes it back towards the bowler
length ball on the pads, moves across and tucks away towards backward square leg
drops at the batsman. Fuller on middle and leg, pushed back
length ball at the stumps, goes back and defends
steered towards deep cover for one
short outside off, 140.6 kph but came much slower off the wicket, was already on its way down when it reached the keeper. Dickwella was looking to ramp it over the slip region but misses
fuller outside off, looks to drive at it and gets beaten
slower one but way down the leg side, Dickwella cannot reach there
length outside off, comes forward and taps it towards point
full but way too outside off, landed after it passed the stumps. Ignored by the batsman
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, goes down on one knee and sweeps it towards square leg. 100 comes up with that boundary
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the stumps, goes for the sweep, gets a top edge but it lands short of the incoming fielder from deep-backward square leg
uses his feet but Yasir slows it down. Tossed up outside off, Dickwella defends
length ball at the stumps and swept hard and in the gap, to the right of short fine leg
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off and middle, turned away towards square leg
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, comes forward and defends towards mid-on
pitched up once again, around off and middle and flicked towards deep square leg
fuller outside off, presents the full face of the bat but doesn't get the timing right. Rolls towards mid-off
fuller on the pads, uses his feet and flicks it towards midwicket. Was in the air for a while but away from any fielder
fuller outside leg, flicks it behind square leg
fuller outside off, goes down and sweeps it towards fine leg
length ball spinning on to the pads from outside the leg stump but nothing alarming as of now. Defended on the front foot
skips down and looks to hit it out of the rough. And up squeezing it towards short fine leg
way too down the leg side. Goes for the sweep, gets the toe of the bat and collects two
length ball outside off, pushes at it without any footwork and gets beaten
fuller and wider outside off. Moves away after landing. Left alone this time
length outside off, around fifth stump, left alone
length ball around off, gets behind it and defends on the leg side
length outside off, punches but doesn't middle, bounces towards the gully fielder
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it down the ground. Shaheen stops it in his followthrough
length ball spinning in from the rough. Flicked towards backward square leg
length ball outside off, a reverse sweep from Dickwella through backward point. Was in the air but no fielder near it
length ball spinning on to the pads, Dickwella removes his top hand and helps it behind square leg
length ball on the middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg
fuller outside off, goes deep in his crease and defends
length ball on middle and leg, defended towards short leg
length ball outside off, looks to steer it past gully but it hits near the shoulder of the bat and bounces towards the keeper

length outside off, goes for the cut and misses
length ball on the pads, looks to flick but is beaten. An appeal for lbw but denied. Might have pitched outside leg
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball on the pads, tucked away behind square leg
dropped by Naseem Shah at backward point. Was a length ball around off and middle. Fernando went for the reverse sweep but couldn't keep it down. Naseem though grassed the chance
fuller around off, looks to flick it against the turn and misses. It spins so big that first slip had to dive to his right to stop it
length ball on the pads, turned on the leg side
fuller on the stumps, defended from the crease
too full on the pads, looks to for the flick but misses. Struck on the pads
fuller around off, drives it towards long-off for one
length ball around off, stays back and defends solidly

a bouncer this time, on middle and leg. Oshada looks to swat it down and gets beaten
length ball around off, slanting across once again. Dribbles towards the right of gully off the outer half
beaten! Was a length ball outside off and holds it line. Dickwella was looking to defend and misses it completely
fuller and wider outside off, left alone
length ball on the pads, tucked away behind square leg
length ball outside off, another reverse sweep from Dickwella. This time towards sweeper cover
fuller around off, skips down and pushes it towards long-on
fuller on middle and leg, flicked but short leg comes in the way
Oshada goes for the reverse this time but cannot connect and is hit on the pad. An appeal for lbw but denied. It landed well outside the leg stump
fuller on the stumps, defended from the front foot
length around off, Dickwella throws his hands at it, opens the face and puts it awat for four behind point
edged but clear of the slips, it was a length ball outside off, he slashed hard again but it flew well over the cordon
fuller around off, pushes hard at it again and enjoys some more luck as the inside edge eludes the stumps and runs away to the fine leg fence
full outside off, comes forward and defends to cover
full outside off, pushed to mid-off's right and they come through for a single
full on middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
short outside off, pushed through the covers for two

full on the pads, smothers the spin coming right to the pitch and works it through square leg for one to move on to 80
full on off and middle, defended to the leg side with the turn
length around middle, turns back in as Dickwella looks to turn it around, pops up on the leg side off the pad for one. apparently, he got some bat on that as well
full on the pads, nudged into the square leg region for a single to retain strike
length outside off, stays low and falls well short of the keeer as the batsman shoulders arms
length on middle, shuffles a touch and pushes it to midwicket
fullish outside off, comes forward and defends to the off side
length around off, jags back and bounces a little extra as Fernando defends towards mid-on

length outside off, comes forward and defends
full outside off, out comes the reverse sweep and he connects well, and even though it was aerial, well away from square leg
length around middle and off this time, goes deep in his crease and tucks it away through square leg for one
length outside off, hint of room and Fernando uses that to dab it to the slip's right, after that the result was never in doubt, delicately done
length around off, comes forward and defends
full outside off, comes forward and defends

length on around middle, pushed to midwicket
full outside off, comes forward and defends to cover
full outside off, comes forward and defends again

length outside off, left alone this time
full outside off, pushed to mid-off

full on middle, defended
full outside off, pushed back to the bowler

slashes and misses as the length ball outside off, leaves him a touch and keeps a tad low

full outside off, pushed it through the overs and times it well for three to bring up his half century, in pretty quick time, just 57 balls

length outside off, defended
full on middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one

full and angled in, gets an inside edge back on the pad as he defends. Pakistan go up in appeal but that would have gone down leg even if there wasn't an edge
full outside off, bit of width and Dickwella caresses it through extra cover for another sublimely times stroke that earns him four
shortens his length a little and it straightens after pitching outside off, Dickwella opens the face and guides it to deep point for one which raises the 100 of the partnership
length outside off, left alone

length outside off, keeps low as Fernando defends with soft hands into the off side and takes off for a run, the thow goes at the striker's end but there's no one backing up which allows Fernando to return for the second
length on the pads, tucked away to dee square leg for one
length outside off, good judgement shown by Dickwella as he watches it into the keeper's gloves
full around off, defended
full and angling in, tucked away into the square leg region for a quick single

bowled him! The otherwise productive reverse sweep proves to be Dickwella's undoing just when he was starting to look really confident! He gave away his intention of playing the stroke too early, Haris fired it on middle, he still went through with the stroke and missed but the ball as it took out leg stump. Took a bit of Dickwella's trouser on the way as well
short one on middle, opens up and works it through midwicket for one
full on middle and leg, defended to midwicket
length outside off, he was shaping to dab it past slip but withdrew at the last moment
lengh outside off, punched to backward point
full and shaping away a touch, Perera has a poke but it's an old ball that hardly carrying anymore, the thick edge bisects the cordon and races to the third man fence
length around off, defended into the covers

short, quick and nasty, into the body of Perera, he has clue about that, takes his eyes off the ball as it seems to come pop up off his arm towards gully. Fell short off the fielder as he came running in. In fact, replays suggest it came off the glove, lucky escape for Perera
full outside off, squeezes it out into the off side
another uncomfortable short one that keeps following Perera, ducks under it
length and angled across, left alone
fuller on middle and off, stands tall and defends back to the bowler

maiden Test hundred for Fernando and something for Sri Lanka to cheer about! It was a length ball angled across, he just guided it through the slips, in full control of the stroke, as has been the case with him throughout the innings
length on the pads, tucked away through square leg for two
length outside off, left alone
has a little flirt and is beaten outside off! It was angled in from around the wicket and shaped away as he pressed forward to defend

what an end to the day for Pakistan! It was full and fast outside off, Perera went for an airy-fairy drive and nicked it to the keeper Rizwan who has taken much tougher catches than this dolly through this innings, forgettable end to the day for Sri Lanka, Pakistan are cock-a-hoop

short and nasty, almost unfair that the No.9 Embuldeniya has to deal with that, he takes his eyes off the ball and but is unable to get his hands out of the way, almost as though trying to protect himself, the ball seemingly kisses the glove on the way to the keeper but the umpire is unmoved. Pakistan take the review and it's a good one, Naseem Shah is on a hat-trick
goes length, fast and straight, the batsman was hanging back expectiong a short one, just brings his bat down and keeps Naseem at bay
short again, this one's outside off, doesn't rise as much, left alone

length outside off, plays inside the line as the ball goes through to the keeper at waist height
tossed up around off, beats the outside edge as he presses forward
full on off, pushed to long-off
that's an absolute ripper, length around leg stump, spins viciously away from the outside edge, too good a ball for the nick
length around off, he has used the dab to good effect, but this time he only manages to guide it to Shafiq at slip, Pakistan one away. Great knock, though, hundred in very trying circumstances.

almost, length around off, eludes the outside edge and the top of off stump by a whisker,

that's full and straight, five for Naseem and victory for Pakistan, that was an inch perfect yoker on middle stump and seemed to have a hint of away tail as it struck him on the boot  right in front of the stumps! He reviews it in hope more than anything, but three reds means the decision stands and Naseem becomes the youngest pacer to pick up a five-for in Tests.
